page.title: 19THE MAYOR'S REGALIA
page.content: { The Great Silver Mace}was presented to the Borough in 1694 by Thomas Lewes and Charles Godfrey and is included in the mayor's regalia. There is an inscription on the mace with their coat of arms and the Royal coat of arms William and Mary. It's original use was to protect the Mayor and this is shown by several heavy knobs along the mace. {The Small Mace of 1687,}was made of ebony and was only 9.75 inches long. It is surmonted by an open arched crown, in silver. In procession the mayor uses a silver stick 38.75 inches long. {The Town Crier}wore an{oval silver {badge,}4.75 inches by 3.5 inches and is worn on the arm. It has on it{the {chained swan of Wycombe,}with a border of laurel leaves.
